shortdesc.ph: Sets the video encoding properties when the host streams directly to the CDN.
Sets the video encoding profile for direct CDN streaming from the host.
Sets the video encoding properties when the host pushes streams directly to the CDN.
Sets the video encoding properties when the host pushes the stream directly to the CDN.

section.p: This method only applies to video captured by the camera, screen sharing, or custom video sources. That is, it applies to video collected when publishCameraTrack or publishCustomVideoTrack is set to in . If the resolution you set exceeds the range supported by your camera device, the SDK adapts it based on your settings and selects the closest resolution with the same aspect ratio for capture, encoding, and streaming. You can get the actual resolution of the pushed video stream via the callback.

This method is only effective for video collected from the camera, screen sharing, or custom video sources, i.e., when publishCameraTrack or publishCustomVideoTrack is set to in . If the resolution you set exceeds the capabilities of your camera device, the SDK adapts the resolution to the closest supported value with the same aspect ratio for capturing, encoding, and streaming. You can use the callback to get the actual resolution of the pushed video stream.

This method only applies to video captured by the camera, screen sharing, or custom video sources. That is, it applies to video captured when publishCameraTrack or publishCustomVideoTrack is set to in . If the video resolution you set exceeds the range supported by your camera device, the SDK adapts based on your settings and captures, encodes, and streams using the closest resolution with the same aspect ratio as your setting. You can get the actual resolution of the pushed video stream through the callback.

This method is only effective for video captured by the camera, screen sharing, or custom video sources. That is, it applies to video captured when publishCameraTrack or publishCustomVideoTrack is set to in . If the resolution you set exceeds the range supported by your camera device, the SDK adapts based on your settings and captures, encodes, and pushes the stream using the closest resolution with the same aspect ratio as your setting. You can get the actual resolution of the pushed video stream via the callback.

plentry.pd: Video encoding parameter configuration. See . When streaming directly to the CDN, the SDK currently only supports setting to landscape (OrientationFixedLandscape) or portrait (OrientationFixedPortrait).
Video encoding configuration. See . When streaming directly to CDN, the SDK currently only supports setting to landscape (OrientationFixedLandscape) or portrait (OrientationFixedPortrait).

Video encoding configuration. See . When pushing streams directly to the CDN, the SDK currently only supports setting to landscape mode (orientationModeFixedLandscape) or portrait mode (orientationModeFixedPortrait).

Video encoding configuration. See . When pushing the stream directly to the CDN, the SDK currently only supports setting to landscape (ORIENTATION_MODE_FIXED_LANDSCAPE) or portrait (ORIENTATION_MODE_FIXED_PORTRAIT) mode.

section.title: Return Values

ul.li: < 0: The method call failed. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
< 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

section.p: When the method call succeeds, there is no return value; when fails, the exception is thrown. You need to catch the exception and handle it accordingly. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.

ul.li: < 0: The method call fails. See [Error Codes](https://docs.agora.io/en/video-calling/troubleshooting/error-codes) for details and resolution suggestions.
